meanings.definition: To express (something) poorly or inaccurately in words.
meanings.sent1: Sometimes, I misphrase my thoughts and confuse others.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misphrase the instructions when explaining them to the students.
meanings.sent3: I misphrase my order at the drive-thru and end up with the wrong food.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement caused her to misphrase her acceptance speech.
meanings.sent5: It's easy to misphrase important details when you're nervous.

meanings.definition: A phrase that is expressed poorly or inaccurately.
meanings.sent1: The misphrase in the article made it hard to understand the main point.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a misphrase in the song lyrics that changed the meaning.
meanings.sent3: The misphrase on the sign caused confusion among the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The misphrase in the recipe led to a disastrous cooking outcome.
meanings.sent5: She found a misphrase in the book that made her laugh out loud.
